abstract.text: The minimum region entirely enclosing the mesh’s vertex positions, expressed in the model coordinate system of the mesh.

inlineContent.text: This property’s value is valid only if the mesh contains vertex data for the
attribute. If the mesh does not contain position information, this property’s value is a bounding box whose
Reading this property for the first time processes the mesh’s vertex data to calculate and cache a bounding box. Reading this property thereafter returns the cached value.

abstract.text: Import, export, and manipulate 3D models using a common infrastructure that integrates MetalKit, GLKit, and SceneKit.

A container for vertex buffer data to be used in rendering a 3D object.
Adds a vertex attribute to the mesh and creates a new, empty corresponding vertex buffer.
The minimum region entirely enclosing the mesh’s vertex positions, expressed in the model coordinate system of the mesh.
The array of submeshes to be used in rendering the mesh.
Returns the vertex data for the specified attribute.
The array of buffers that provide vertex data for the mesh.
The number of vertices in the mesh.
A description of the format and layout of the mesh’s vertex buffers.
Returns the minimum region entirely enclosing the object’s contents at the specified time sample.
The attribute data describes vertex positions.
